info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 3:42PM MDT until August 26 at 5:45PM MDT by NWS Grand Junction CO
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo...small stream and low land flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Utah, including the following county, San Juan near La Sal Junction.
* WHEN...Until 545 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 342 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.3 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Sal Junction and areas along 191 and State Route 46. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
